snippet: A 'Bush' Web Site, Woven From Mischief       Every major Presidential hopeful has an Internet site that voters, journalists and the just-plain-curious can visit for biographical information, campaign schedules, speech texts and the like. Some have...
lead_paragraph: A 'Bush' Web Site, Woven From Mischief Every major Presidential hopeful has an Internet site that voters, journalists and the just-plain-curious can visit for biographical information, campaign schedules, speech texts and the like. Some have several sites. It's the way the political game is played on the cusp of the new millennium. But there is mischief afoot on the Web.
abstract: Zack Exley of Somerville, Mass, has created anti-George W Bush site on Internet; Sen Ron Wyden wants Congress to pass legislation that will encourage more candidates to forswear negative television advertisements; Assemblyman Bob Hertzberg and State Sen Kevin Murray are pushing legislation that would permit Election Day registration in California; photo (M)
